issue.title: Consider differences in heading sensor plugin options: IMU and GPS-based

content.raw:
I believe I have found the point of contention concerning the heading.

The nmea plugin publishes GPHDT message, which gives heading in nautical degrees \(with noise\).

The hector plugin publishes a quaternian with noise.

The in order to achieve the same interface with hector as the nmea, the team should:

convert from quat to euler angles \(Vector3\)

offset to match nautical standard

\(see lines 377 -379 [https://github.com/OUXT-Polaris/nmea\_gps\_plugin/blob/master/src/nmea\_gps\_plugin.cpp](https://github.com/OUXT-Polaris/nmea_gps_plugin/blob/master/src/nmea_gps_plugin.cpp)\)

convert rotation around the z \(in radians\) to degrees

\(see lines 269 to 274 [https://github.com/OUXT-Polaris/nmea\_gps\_plugin/blob/master/src/nmea\_gps\_plugin.cpp](https://github.com/OUXT-Polaris/nmea_gps_plugin/blob/master/src/nmea_gps_plugin.cpp)\)
